conclusion: Determine the distance s between two adjacent bullets in the air.
Determine the relative velocity of the bullet with respect to Cart B.
The bullet is fired from Cart A with a speed v_0 relative to the ground.
Cart A is moving to the left with a speed v_1, and Cart B is moving to the right with a speed v_2.
The relative velocity of the bullet with respect to Cart B is v_rel = v_0 + v_1 + v_2.
Determine the time interval between two consecutive bullets hitting the target.
The time interval between two consecutive bullets being fired is Δt_0.
Each bullet hits the target when the next bullet has already been fired.
The time interval between two consecutive bullets hitting the target is Δt_0.
Calculate the distance traveled by the bullet relative to Cart B in the time interval Δt_0.
The distance s between two adjacent bullets in the air is s = v_rel ⋅ Δt_0.
Substituting the value of v_rel: s = (v_0 + v_1 + v_2) ⋅ Δt_0.
The distance between two adjacent bullets in the air is (v_0 + v_1 + v_2) Δt_0.
